intro: Cards offer various boosts and advantages in Plants vs Brainrots. When placed in card slots, they can boost spawn rates of rare Brainrots, increase plant damage, enhance luck, and trigger special events. The card system has transformed the game's collection experience, encouraging players to build optimal card decks for strategic gameplay.
Each card pack contains 5 cards of similar or different rarities. High-rarity cards like Legendary and Epic have low drop chances but provide powerful boosts and effects.
cardNote: We will complete the card information as soon as possible after the card system update

cards.name: Brainrot Blessing
cards.description: 10% increased income from all brainrots

cards.name: Whirlwind
cards.description: Every 100 brainrots slain, summons a tornado that knocks brainrots to the start

cards.name: Batter Up
cards.description: Bats deal 25% more damage

cards.name: Sunflower Flurry
cards.description: Sunflowers have a 10% chance to attack +1 time

cards.name: Pumpkin Flurry
cards.description: Pumpkins have a 10% chance to attack +1 times

cards.name: Cactus Flurry
cards.description: Cacti have a 10% chance to attack +1 times

cards.name: Rare Collection
cards.description: 25% higher chance for Rare brainrots to spawn

cards.name: Epic Collection
cards.description: 25% higher chance for Epic brainrots to spawn

cards.name: Secret Slayer
cards.description: Every time you slay a secret rarity, instantly get cash equal to 10× your Cash per minute

cards.name: Solar Burst
cards.description: Every 200 brainrots slain, instantly grants 10 minutes of bonus money based on $/s

cards.name: Chain Lightning
cards.description: Every 50 brainrots slain, summons chain lightning that strikes 5 random brainrots for 10,000 damage

cards.name: Home Run
cards.description: Every brainrot slain by a bat deals 80% of its max HP to all active brainrots

cards.name: Legendary Collection
cards.description: 25% higher chance for Legendary brainrots to spawn

cards.name: Time Blossom
cards.description: After slaying 100 brainrots, slow time by 50% for 10 seconds

cards.name: Spirit Bloom
cards.description: Every 25 brainrots slain, randomly buff one plant with 10% Rage for 10 seconds

cards.name: Plant Frenzy
cards.description: Every 25 brainrots slain by a plant sends it into 100% Frenzy for 8 seconds

cards.name: Frozen Frenzy
cards.description: Plants deal Additional 35% more damage to frozen Brainrots

cards.name: Tile Trio
cards.description: If three plants with the same type are on the same tile, they have 15% increased damage

cards.name: Bloom Bank
cards.description: 10% of all currency earned is stored; unleashed as a 3x payout burst when you slay 500 brainrots

cards.name: Meteor Strike
cards.description: Every 50 brainrots slain, a meteor strikes dealing 25,000 damage to all brainrots

cards.name: Freezing Field
cards.description: Every 50 brainrots slain, freeze all brainrots for 5 seconds

cards.name: Rizzroot Manifestation
cards.description: Luck is increased by 50%

cards.name: Bloom Ascendant
cards.description: After slaying 1,000 brainrots, buff all plants' stats by 100% for 5 minutes

cards.name: Petal Storm
cards.description: Every 10th hit from a plant releases a wave of petals that deal 5,000 AoE damage

cards.name: Mono-Crop Mindset
cards.description: When an entire row is the same plant type, they deal 15% more damage

cards.name: Aura
cards.description: As long as there is a boss in the lane, all brainrot enemies are 50% weakened

cards.name: Ovargreth
cards.description: A mysterious and powerful entity with unknown abilities

cards.name: Inferno Petal
cards.description: Magma brainrots explode for 10% of their max HP on death

cards.name: Mythic Collection
cards.description: 25% higher chance for Mythic brainrots to spawn

cards.name: Doom Bloom
cards.description: 35% more damage

cards.name: Toxic Cloud
cards.description: Slaying a brainrot has a 5% chance to release a poisonous cloud dealing 100 damage per second

cards.name: Frozen Blast
cards.description: Frozen brainrots take 1,000 damage per second

cards.name: Godly Collection
cards.description: 25% higher chance for Godly brainrots to spawn

cards.name: Limited Collection
cards.description: 25% higher chance for Limited brainrots to spawn

cards.name: Secret Collection
cards.description: 25% higher chance for Secret brainrots to spawn

sections.title: How to Get Cards
intro: Cards are obtained from Card Packs through several methods:

entries.title: 1. Rebirths
body: Rebirths provide card packs as rewards starting from Rebirth 2 onwards. Besides offering higher Money and Luck multipliers, each rebirth grants card pack rewards. You can perform up to 6 rebirths total, though each requires minimum cash and specific Brainrots in your base. Note that rebirthing resets all cash, boss levels, and upgrades.

entries.title: 2. Daily Rewards
body: Access daily rewards by entering the door portal to Central Island. Find the platform on the right side listing available daily rewards and grand prizes. Card packs may appear as grand prizes - obtain them by placing required Brainrots on the four platforms. Remember: characters cannot be reclaimed once placed.

entries.title: 3. Events
body: Card packs are available through special events like the Brainrot Hit List. This event requires defeating specific Brainrots in exchange for rewards. Check the board near NPC Tomade Torelli in Central Island for target information and elimination requirements.

entries.title: 4. Shop Purchase
body: Skip the grind by purchasing Shiny Card Packs directly from the in-game Shop:
You can also gift card packs to friends using the present icon next to the Robux button.

entries.title: Equipping Cards
body: Equipping cards is straightforward in Plants vs Brainrots:

items: Head to the Player Cards station located on the right side of the spawner
Approach one of the available card slots
Hold the E key on PC and select a card from your collection
The card's perk activates immediately upon equipping

entries.title: Card Slots System
body: The card slot system adds strategic importance to the Rebirth progression, as more slots allow for greater card synergies and more powerful combinations.

items: Total of 5 card slots available at maximum progression
Cards placed in slots provide active benefits during gameplay

sections.title: Card Merging System
intro: Upgrade your cards through the merging system located in Central Island:

items: Requirements: 3 identical cards of the same type
Location: Card Merging station in Central Island
Process: Combine 3 similar cards to create a higher-tier version
Result: Enhanced card with improved effects and bonuses

notes: ⚠️ Important: Card merging is permanent and cannot be undone. Plan your merges carefully to optimize your deck.

entries.title: Stacking with Potions
body: Card benefits can stack with potions for enhanced effects. For example, use a Lucky Potion combined with the Secret Collection card to spawn more Secret Brainrots, maximizing your rare spawn rates.

entries.title: Strategic Deck Building
body: With 5 card slots available, focus on creating synergistic combinations that complement your playstyle:
The 5-slot limitation forces strategic decisions about which abilities to prioritize, transforming the game from passive tower defense to active strategic planning.

items: Offensive builds: Cards that boost plant damage and attack speed
Economic builds: Cards that increase income and rare spawn rates
Balanced builds: Mix of offensive and economic benefits
